Main.h1: International Competition on Artificial Intelligence for Children

Banner.titleH2:
Congratulations!
You are now registered
for the contest.
Banner.text:
The tasks will be made available on the website on 15 February.
However, you can check out your first task and give it a try right now!
Banner.textStage2:
Before the team round starts, you need to set up your team or join an existing one.
To do that, solve the tasks of the qualifying round.
Banner.titleH2Stage3:
The offline round
is taking place
in Moscow at the end of the year.
Banner.textStage3: Following the team round, we will select best teams who will get together in Moscow for the finals. Ten winner teams will get 1,000,000 ₽ each.

HorizontalRow: International artificial intelligence competition for children

NotActivated.titleH3: Your account has not been activated yet.
NotActivated.text:
You do not have access to the tasks until your account is activated.
Please see the FAQ for step-by-step instructions on how to activate your account in a couple of clicks.

VerificationModal.codeNotWorks: The released code is no longer valid

Audience.Card1Subtitle: The contest is open to school students in any grade.
Audience.Card2Subtitle: School knowledge is sufficient to participate. We will teach you the rest along the line.
Audience.Card3Subtitle: No matter where you are, location is not going to get in the way of you fighting for the top prize.

Stages.Point1Text: Individual participation that involves getting to know task types and learning new approaches to solving non-standard problems.
Stages.Point2Text: Building teams, choosing one of ten contest domains, and fighting to get into the final.
Stages.Point3Text: Top 50 teams get together in Moscow. Transport and accommodation costs are covered by the contest.

StagesPrize.Commands:
Each of ten
winner teams
gets more than
€ 10 000*
StagesPrize.Offer: Apply now to be among the first </br> to get started with the tasks!

Questions.Item1Title: How hard are the tasks that I will have to deal with?
Questions.Item1Text: You will need high school level of knowledge to solve most of the tasks. Again, we have prepared guides, video tutorials, and lectures that will help you to quickly find the missing information.
Questions.Item2Title: How much time will I have to solve the tasks?
Questions.Item2Text: You can get started with the tasks anytime before the round is over. After the deadline, solutions cannot be submitted anymore.
Questions.Item3Title: What is the qualifying round aimed at?
Questions.Item3Text:
The qualifying round is your chance to get an idea of the tasks and to prove yourself among other participants. This will help you to create your dream team or join an existing group.

If you participate with your friends, each one of you will have to upload your individual solutions for the qualifying round first in order to get into the next one. During the second round, you can team up and work on the tasks together.
Questions.Item4Text: Building teams of 3 to 5 people takes place before the second round starts. Each of the participants can set up their own team or join an existing one.
Questions.Item5Text: Best teams in 10 domains make it to the offline round. Each team has to perform a final task together, which is then evaluated by the judging panel. The gold winners in each domain will be announced as the winners of the contest. For more details, please read the Contest Regulations.

Footer.Subheader: For any questions, please email us at
Footer.CopyrightExtra: All materials belong to their copyright holder.
Footer.Details: * the amount of the prize fund in euros is indicated at the exchange rate in effect on the date of the announcement of the competition (1.02.21). The amount is subject to recalculation depending on the euro exchange rate in effect on the date of summing up the results of the competition.

Helmet.MetaTitle: AIIJC – Artificial Intelligence International Junior Contest
Helmet.MetaDesc: We have prepared a bunch of interesting tasks for you. Join our contest now!

progress.title: Progress

qualification.title: Complete the qualification
qualification.text: To complete the qualifying round, you need to meet the passing score in one of the task.

progress.descriptionText: To participate in the team round, you need to unlock your profile. To do this, you need to get parents’ consent for your participation in the contest.
progress.descriptionTextProfileUnlocked: Congratulations! Now you can edit your profile to participate in the team round.
progress.descriptionTextProfileUnlockedAndFull:
You are getting really close to participation in the team round. We will publish tasks for this round twice a week so that you could get an idea of them beforehand.

You will be able to start solving these tasks after 30 April when building teams becomes available. Up until then, you can keep improving your result for the tasks already available.

TaskDetail.teamTermNotification1: To select a track your team should have from 3 to 5 members.
TaskDetail.teamTermNotification2: Solution will be uploaded for all the team! Please kindly inform and advice with your team about solution uploading. Further changes will be impossible.

Verification.SMStext: We sent an SMS with a confirmation code to the specified phone number. Enter it below to be able to edit your profile.
